title: Plea Deal May Be Near for a Bali Bombing Defendant at Guantánamo
description: The case of a Guantánamo detainee charged by a military commission over terrorist attacks in Indonesia two decades ago is no longer joined to that of two other defendants.

title: Bill Pinkney, Globe-Circling Sailor Who Set a Racial Mark, Dies at 87
description: He was the first Black person to sail alone by way of the arduous southern route, rounding the perilous Cape Horn and withstanding storms and loneliness.

title: U.S. Knew About Migrant Killings by Saudi Forces Earlier Than Previously Disclosed
description: The State Department says diplomats in Riyadh learned of the atrocities from research groups last summer, contradicting an earlier statement that the United States was not aware until December.

title: No Charges Filed Over Death of Adama Traoré in France
description: Adama Traoré, 24, died in 2016 shortly after three officers pinned him to the ground during an arrest. His case became a symbol for activists protesting police violence in France.

title: Body Is Found in Search for Missing British Poet
description: The police said they had found a man’s body after a search for Gboyega Odubanjo, 27, who was last seen on Saturday at a music festival in England where he was set to perform.

title: Hezbollah Sanctions Case Highlights Frailties in the Art Market
description: In its indictment of a collector accused of helping the militant group, U.S. prosecutors presented evidence of how easily art sales can be used to evade sanctions and launder money.

title: As Anniversary of Women’s Uprising Nears, Iran Cracks Down
description: Sept. 16 marks one year since Mahsa Amini died in the custody of the morality police, setting off months of protests. Authorities are trying to quell any new unrest.

title: What I’m Reading: Buried Secrets
description: In countries that have emerged from brutal 20th-century dictatorships, the past isn’t staying in the past.

title: Paris Becomes the First European Capital to Ban Rented Electric Scooters
description: But the city is adding bike lanes, and scooter companies are shifting their focus to electric bikes. E-scooters killed three people and wounded 459 others in Paris last year.

title: French Citizen Killed After Straying Into Algerian Waters
description: The man was among a group including French-Moroccan dual citizens vacationing in northern Morocco when their water scooters, low on fuel, drifted and the coast guard opened fire.

title: Survivor of South Africa Fire Describes a Harrowing Escape
description: Tom Mandala, a Malawi native, jumped from the fifth floor as a blaze raged in a Johannesburg residential building. Many other residents were also from Malawi.

title: Idalia Approaches Bermuda
description: The remnants of the former hurricane were forecast to strengthen into a tropical storm again over the weekend as it neared the island.

title: Thai King Commutes Sentence of Former Prime Minister Thaksin
description: Thaksin Shinawatra’s eight-year punishment was reduced to one year, days after his return from self-imposed exile. He remains one of the country’s most influential politicians.

title: Russia, Belarus and Iran Are Invited to 2023 Nobel Prize Ceremony
description: The executive director of the Nobel Foundation said it was reversing course from a year ago in an effort lower tensions at a time of growing geopolitical divisions.

title: Identifying Victims in South African Fire Is a Grim Struggle
description: Families on Friday were trying to identify relatives caught in the blaze, a day after it consumed a sprawling settlement in one of the deadliest residential fires in South African history.

title: What to Know About the Deadly Johannesburg Fire
description: The blaze, one of the worst residential ones in South Africa’s history, occurred in a building that officials and locals say had become an overcrowded death trap for the hundreds who lived there.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Mercenary Leader’s Longtime Lieutenant Is Buried
description: Dmitri Utkin was killed alongside Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the Wagner founder, in a plane crash last week. U.S. and other officials have said they believe that an explosion on board caused the crash.

title: As Ukraine’s Fight Falters, It Gets Even Harder to Talk About Negotiations
description: Discussion of a negotiated Plan B, should Ukraine fail to win a total victory, has become more unseemly than ever and is now nearly a taboo, say those who have tried.

title: Europe’s ‘Tormented History’ Drives an Ambitious Macron Protégé
description: Clément Beaune, who had a double coming out as a gay man with Jewish roots, wants to be mayor of Paris, revive the center-left and build the united Europe he cherishes.

title: Airline Sold Tickets for Already Canceled Flights, Watchdog Group Says
description: Australia’s consumer commission said in legal proceedings that Qantas, the country’s national carrier, had sold tickets for routes it never intended to fly.

title: Textbooks for Russian High Schoolers Try to Justify Ukraine War
description: The textbooks, which cover Russian history from 1945 to present, also reimagine the brutality of Joseph Stalin’s policies.

title: Promising unwavering support for Ukraine, the U.K. replaces its ex-soldier defense secretary with a savvy politician.
U.S. Officials Have Visited China. Will Beijing Send Anyone?
description: Such visits could help convey Beijing’s interest in stabilizing ties with Washington. But China has been noncommittal.

title: Friday Briefing
description: The deaths of dozens of people in a fire in South Africa.

title: Pope Visits Mongolia, With an Eye on Russia and China
description: The pontiff arrived Friday on a trip that the Vatican said was meant to encourage the fewer than 1,500 Catholics there. But it also brings him close to two great powers that have vexed him.

title: Could Australia and New Zealand Become One Nation?
description: A New Zealand lawmaker talked about the idea last week, though a union is unlikely ever to take place.
